name: MRDuino with Max MSP
short_description:
Using Max MSP/Maxuino  to design interfaces and communicate with other software programs such as iTunes, as well as communicate wirelessly with my iTouch from my Macbook, to create a command center for performance enhancements and monitoring of various sensors, as well as providing superior firewire sound environment in my MKI.5 MR2.

The sound environment is complete, with my iTouch acting as a multi-display gauge mounted on my console, as well as a control center at my fingertips without my hands even leaving the wheel of my car. The iTouch actually controls the actions of my Macbook through Max MSP, playing songs and switching playlists at firewire quality, NOT playing songs off the iTouch at all.

Now I focus on controlling the car's TVIS system, or variable intake butterfly control. The software is designed in Max already, all I need is a consistent real-time RPM signal which can be fed through the Arduino into Max MSP. Harder said than done, due to Maxuino's ISR limitations.
summary: Max MSP/Arduino to create command center for MR2 sensors and controls
